intro: Cracca phaecosperma, commonly known as the black crac, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in marshy or aquatic environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. The plant plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various insect species.
